intro: Palaua camanensis, commonly known as the Pacific sedge, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of the Pacific Northwest. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy habitats and has narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are clustered in spikelets, and it plays a role in stabilizing soil in wetland ecosystems. Palaua camanensis is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its adaptability and resilience.
